history.content: In general 168/188 are both relatively light workload, 168 is probably more applicable to industry as it teaches you how computing systems work today rather than 188 which is cool theory but probably not enough for you to get a job in any AI related field. 61C is not too conceptually difficult but will have a hellish project period and 170 will have relatively long problem sets, although this varies a lot student to student. I typically spent 15 hours on cs70 psets and 5-10 on 170 psets. 61C projects (weekly 'part') take maybe 10 +- 5. 61C + 170 + 188 is what I would take.

I'm wondering whether to take CS 61C + CS 170 + CS 168 or CS 61C + CS 170 + CS 188.

What will be more beneficial to me for internships (168 vs 188) and what is a lighter workload as I want to focus on doing well in 170 (as I heard is hard and time consuming)
history.subject: CS 61C + CS 170 + CS 168 Good idea? Or CS 188?
